overview:

On macOS, [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/WindowGroup] and [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/DocumentGroup] scenes will use the `principal` role. [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Window] scenes will use the `principal` role when they are specified as the first scene in the app’s definition, and use the `associated` role otherwise. # automatic

**Type Property**

The automatic role. The type and configuration of the scene will be used to determine how its windows behave in full screen and Stage Manager.

## Declaration

```swift
static let automatic: WindowManagerRole
```

## Discussion

On macOS, [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/WindowGroup] and [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/DocumentGroup] scenes will use the `principal` role. [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Window] scenes will use the `principal` role when they are specified as the first scene in the app’s definition, and use the `associated` role otherwise. [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Settings] will use the `associated` role.
title: automatic
